result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J Boersma was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance of fine to be paid at $50 per month commencing 07-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter or serve 25 days huber, consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.

Cash bail applied to Blood Draw Fee and DNA surcharge - PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Huber with standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.
AMENDED 03-31-2016:  Apply 20 days sentence credit.

5/11/2017 - DEFENDANT DISCHARGED FROM ATC.  DEFENDANT IS TO SERVE BALANCE OF ORIGINAL SENTENCE.  DEFENDANT IS ENTITLED TO ADDITIONAL 120 DAYS OF CREDIT FOR A TOTAL OF 140 DAYS since released from Huber to ATC on 4/22/16.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant has attended a Victim Impact Panel prior to sentencing.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas J Boersma in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant applied but does not qualify for representation by the public defender's office and requests the Court appoint an attorney.  The Defendant is sworn in and the Court finds the Defendant is eligible and will appoint an attorney at the repayment rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/1/17.  The Court appoints Attorney Nicholas Martinez pending his acceptance of the appointment.

Defendant Thomas J Boersma in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State moves for discharge.
